title: First-Timer's Wales Sampler
tagline: The greatest hits for your first Welsh adventure
suitableFor: Families with children aged 8+, beginner adventurers, and those wanting a taste of North and West Wales.
notSuitableFor: Experienced mountaineers looking for challenging climbs or those seeking a purely relaxing holiday.

stops.title: Velocity 2 Zip Line
stops.description: Experience the thrill of flying over Penrhyn Quarry on the world's fastest zip line. You'll be harnessed in and launched down a stunning slope.

wetAlt.title: Bounce Below
wetAlt.description: Jump and explore giant trampolines in a disused slate mine at Zip World Llechwedd. Fun for all ages.

budgetAlt.title: Watkin Path Waterfall Walk
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk to the waterfalls near Pont Bethania. A free and beautiful natural attraction.

stops.title: Pete's Eats
stops.description: A classic mountaineering cafe in Llanberis, serving hearty portions and great atmosphere.
stops.travelToNext: 5min drive to Llanberis Path car park

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Padarn
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own picnic by the beautiful Llyn Padarn lake in Llanberis.

stops.title: Llanberis Path Guided Walk (Partial)
stops.description: Hike part of the Llanberis Path up Snowdon. A good taste of the mountain without a full summit attempt. Great views.

wetAlt.title: National Slate Museum
wetAlt.description: Learn about the history of the slate industry at this fascinating museum. It's a great glimpse into Wales' industrial past.

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Llyn Padarn
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a leisurely walk around the lake in Llanberis, taking in the views of Snowdon.

stops.title: YHA Snowdon Llanberis
stops.description: A well-located hostel in Llanberis, perfect for exploring Snowdonia. Family rooms available.

stops.title: White Water Rafting
stops.description: Experience the thrill of white water rafting at the National White Water Centre near Bala. Suitable for beginners.

wetAlt.title: Indoor Climbing at the Beacon Climbing Centre
wetAlt.description: Enjoy indoor climbing and bouldering in a safe and controlled environment.

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Llyn Tegid (Bala Lake)
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a walk around Bala Lake (Llyn Tegid), the largest natural lake in Wales.

stops.title: Plas Coch Hotel
stops.description: A hotel with a great view in Bala serving food. A good place for lunch and a relax.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic by Llyn Tegid
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own packed lunch by the lake.

stops.title: Drive to St Davids
stops.description: Drive along the scenic Welsh roads to St Davids, Pembrokeshire.

stops.title: St Davids YHA
stops.description: A comfortable and well-located hostel in the heart of St Davids, ideal for exploring the Pembrokeshire coast.

budgetAlt.title: TYF Cliff-top Campsite
budgetAlt.description: Camping with stunning coastal views near St Davids.

stops.title: Coasteering Classic
stops.description: Explore the Pembrokeshire coast with TYF Adventure, swimming, climbing, and jumping into the sea. All levels welcome.

wetAlt.title: St Davids Cathedral Visit
wetAlt.description: Explore the historic St Davids Cathedral, a beautiful and peaceful place to learn about Welsh history.

budgetAlt.title: Coastal Path Walk to St Non's Bay
budgetAlt.description: Walk along the Pembrokeshire Coast Path to St Non's Bay, a beautiful and historic site with a holy well.

stops.title: The Whitesands Beach Cafe
stops.description: Beach cafe with a great view serving lunch

budgetAlt.title: Picnic on Whitesands Beach
budgetAlt.description: Bring your own packed lunch to enjoy on the beach.

stops.title: Surfing Lesson
stops.description: Learn to surf at Whitesands Beach with TYF Adventure. Beginner friendly lessons.

wetAlt.title: Oriel y Parc Gallery and Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Visit the Oriel y Parc Gallery in St Davids to see local art and learn about the Pembrokeshire Coast National Park.

budgetAlt.title: Relaxing on Whitesands Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy swimming, sunbathing, or building sandcastles on Whitesands Beach.

stops.title: Drive to Betws-y-Coed
stops.description: Drive from St Davids to Betws-y-Coed.

stops.title: Plas y Brenin
stops.description: Adventure Hotel in Capel Curig, 10 mins from Betws-y-Coed.

stops.title: Zip World Fforest Coaster
stops.description: Ride the Fforest Coaster, a gravity-driven toboggan run through the trees at Zip World Fforest in Betws-y-Coed.

wetAlt.title: Explore Betws-y-Coed Village
wetAlt.description: Browse the shops, visit the St Michael's Church, and enjoy the riverside walks in the charming village of Betws-y-Coed.

budgetAlt.title: Waterfall walk in Betws-y-Coed
budgetAlt.description: Walk to the iconic Swallow Falls near Betws-y-Coed (small entrance fee applies).

budgetAlt.title: Picnic by the River Conwy
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic by the picturesque River Conwy in Betws-y-Coed.

stops.title: Walk to Conwy Falls
stops.description: A short drive from Betws-y-Coed is the wonderful Conwy Falls.

wetAlt.title: Explore Conwy Castle
wetAlt.description: Visit the World Heritage Site, a medieval castle, for a historical day out.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Expect changeable weather, even in summer. Pack layers and waterproofs. Coastal areas can be windy.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in Snowdonia, especially during peak season. Allow extra time for driving and parking. St Davids parking can be tricky in summer too, arrive early.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Book Zip World activities and coasteering in advance, especially during school holidays. Consider booking Snowdon accommodation well in advance as well.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A reasonable level of fitness is required for the Snowdon hike and coasteering. The other activities are suitable for most people.
